oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Impact of a FACTS controller on reliability of composite power generation and transmission system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VERMA, AK
SRIVIDYA, A
DEKA, BIMAL C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: synchronous generators
large scale systems
mathematical models
electric loads
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper proposes an optimization model to use in composite power system reliability evaluation method incorporating the impact of FACTS devices. The conventional dc flow-based linear programming model used in composite system reliability evaluation method is converted into a non-linear optimization model to include the impact of FACTS devices on reliability of power system. The proposed model is tested on 24-bus IEEE-reliability test system (RTS). Annualized reliability indices are calculated using the model and compared with the indices calculated without considering FACTS devices.
